Legal_Issue: Did the visa officer improperly use the LICO table and breach the duty of fairness?
Application_Facts: Applicant scored 68 out of 70 required points; lacked sufficient liquid funds and knowledge of Canada; property value and transferability not clarified
Decision_Outcome: Application rejected due to insufficient funds and lack of preparedness
Court_Ruling: Visa officer fettered discretion by over-reliance on LICO table and breached procedural fairness; case remitted for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to advise applicant of concerns regarding property value and transferability; over-reliance on LICO table
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide applicant with opportunity to respond to concerns about property value
Relief_Sought: Allow judicial review and remit decision for re-determination
Governing_Rule: Visa officers must not rely solely on LICO; must afford procedural fairness where concerns arise
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of clarification on property value and liquidity
Outcome: Application allowed; decision set aside; remitted to a different visa officer
Decisional_Body: Visa Officer at Canadian visa office
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of immigration opportunity due to lack of procedural fairness
Cause_Description: Insufficient funds and lack of preparedness
Evidence_Handling: Failure to seek clarification on key financial evidence
Legal_Provision_Violated: Implied duty of procedural fairness under IRPA
Evidence_Issues: Unclear valuation and transferability of foreign property
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete assessment of financial eligibility due to unverified property claims
Decision_Rationale: Over-reliance on LICO table without considering other factors; failure to provide notice of concerns
Decision_Making_Body: Visa Officer, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentation or verification regarding asset liquidity
